strings: <Cap><leader> discovers a new recipe for the alchemy pot!
<Cap><string_1> <equal> <Cap><string_2> + <Cap><string_3>
<Cap><string_1> <equal> <Cap><string_2> + <Cap><string_3> + <Cap><string_4>
<se_def>*: This is Pickham, 'ome of impropriety, crime and vulgarity!
<se_def>*: You look like <IF_SOLO>an outsider<ELSE_NOT_SOLO>outsiders<ENDIF_SOLO>. You might wanna think about keepin' yer stay as short as possible.
<se_def>*: Yer bound to end up in trouble otherwise. This town's full of ugly customers. Believe me, you don't wanna get mixed up wiv 'em!
<se_low>*: This is my patch. You wanna come through 'ere, ya pay me some dosh. Ten gold coins.

<se_low>*: Yer a sensible <IF_MALE>man<ELSE_NOT_MALE>lady<ENDIF_MALE>!
Better to pay, as I always say!
Heh heh heh!
<se_low>*: You ain't got the dough!? Just my bleedin' luck! Well you ain't comin' through 'ere then!

<se_low>*: Ruddy <IF_SOLO>cheapskate<ELSE_NOT_SOLO>cheapskates<ENDIF_SOLO>! No pay, no way!
Now get out of 'ere! Yer spoilin' me view!
<se_low>*: Go on, then! Get movin'! And make it quick! Otherwise you'll 'ave to pay again!
<se_def>*: This watchtower was built to defend the town against barbarian raiders. But to tell ya the truth, there ain't much point.
<se_def>*: All the barbarians who'd ever be likely to raid Pickham already live 'ere!<page>*: You'd be betta off watchin' wot's goin' on inside town, not outside!
<se_def>*: Ev'ryone livin' 'ere in Pickham's 'ere cos they ain't been let in nowhere else, right.

<se_def>*: But this place lets ev'ryone in. Even me.
It's a bloomin' good job, an' all.
<se_def>*: Where else can ya find an inn wiv its own pub 'n' garden, eh? There ain't no betta place to stay, nowhere!
<se_def>*: If yer stoppin' overnight in Pickham, there's only one place to rest yer 'ead. The Lock Inn! Come on in! Do some time!

<se_high>*: Oh, pur-lease! Tell me I'm dreamin'!
Yangy, is that really you!? Course it is!
I'd know that burly figure anywhere!
How are ya!?

<se_high>*: It's been ages! You've changed a bit, ain't ya!?
Look at you, all smart now!
I could 'ardly recognise ya!

<se_high>*: Oh, pur-lease! Take them away!
Look at you, goin' around flauntin' yer assets!
Cover yerself up!

<se_high>*: I dunno, young women today!
They ain't got no shame!

<se_high>*: Oh, pur-lease! I'm much too old for you,
you saucy devil!
<se_high>*: Stop tryin' to chat me up!
<se_high>*: Tah hah hah! I know, I know! This old bird may 'ave lost a few feathers over the years, but she's still got some tasty meat on 'er!
<se_def>*: (Whimpa)

<se_low>*: This is the start of beggars' alley,
'ome to the poorest o' the poor.
<se_low>*: Ya might wanna get a good grip on yer wallet, eh!? Heh heh!

<se_low>*: Urgh, I'm so 'ungry! But I ain't got nuffin'.
No grub, no dosh. No real desire to work.

<se_low>*: I can't be bothered to do nuffin'.
Best just go to sleep 'ere 'til the 'unger passes.
<se_def>*: Lend me some cash, mate! I ain't got a penny. Not even enough for a drink tonight. Come on! Five gold coins, that's all I'm askin'. Please.
<se_def>*: Oh, thanks a million. I won't forget ya.
<se_def>*: Not until this little lot disappears down me throat, any'ow!
<se_def>*: You wot!? You ain't even got five gold coins!? ...Yer one of us, then! You 'n' me are mates! Beggars can't be choosers, eh!? Heh heh!
<se_def>*: Wot!? Ya can't even spare five gold coins!? You tight little<endash> Miser! Skinflint!
<se_def>*: Oh, you're the one who gave me that cash before, ain't ya? See, I told ya I wouldn't forget ya, didn't I!?
<se_def>*: Not until this little lot disappears down me throat, any'ow!
<se_def>*: I 'eard there's a place southwest of 'ere where some great thief lives. One o' the best, they say. An' get this! She's a woman!
<se_def>*: I bet she's a right selfish, stubborn, seductive temptress! Just my type!

<se_low>*: My wife left me, my son went off the rails,
I lost everythin'. And I just kinda drifted here to Pickham, really.
<se_low>*: But no one here pays any attention to that kinda stuff. I can get on with me life in peace! Aaah, things couldn't be better!
<se_def>*: I heard there was a man who knows everythin' about everythin' here. I've come a long way to see him.
<se_def>*: But I can't figure out where on earth he lives! This town's like a maze!

<se_low>*: There was a geezer, who used to live 'ere,
by the name o' Yangus. He was a right monkey!<page>*: Used to try an' make out 'e was cleverer than wot he was by usin' long words!

<se_low>*: But he was always gettin' 'em wrong!
He'd say stuff like ‘spific’ instead of ‘specific’,
and ‘gratistude’ instead of ‘gratitude’!<page>*: Made 'im sound like a prize ignoranus!

<se_low>*: I wonder wot 'e's up to these days.
Be a shame if 'e was lyin' face down in some ditch somewhere! Kah ha hah!

<se_low>*: Y-Yangus!? When did you get back!?
Yer, er...lookin' good as ever, eh!?

<se_low>*: I was dead worried when I didn't 'ear nuffin' from ya after ya left town. But now yer back!
Ha ha! An' yer awright an' ev'ryfin'!
<se_high>*: Meo'! ('Iss!)

<se_high>*: Ahhh! Take it! Take wotever ya want!
But there's nuffin' of value 'ere, I swear!

<se_high>*: ...Huh? Yer not <IF_SOLO>a burglar<ELSE_NOT_SOLO>burglars<ENDIF_SOLO>? Oh, I'm sorry.
It's just there's been so many break-ins recently,
I was sure...

<se_high>*: It's dangerous for a girl livin' on 'er own,
isn't it? Perhaps I better buy somefin' to defend meself wiv. Just in case.

<se_low>*: I'm cleaning the bath at the minute.
You'll slip and bang your head if you come in here now.
<se_high>*: We used to live in a town called Baccarat. There's a casino there, you see, and my husband's a big gambler.
<se_high>*: Why did we move here? Why do you think!? To escape the debt-collectors, of course!

<se_def>*: We get all sorts in 'ere!
Some people 'ave pasts you wouldn't believe!
<se_def>*: A good barman knows not to ask too many questions.
<se_def>*: Eh! Have you 'eard? 'Ic!

<se_def>*: How come you know about it!?
You been goin' to that shop an' all, 'ave ya?
<se_def>*: Don't go tellin' no one, right, but <endash> 'Ic! <endash> there's a geezer 'round 'ere wot buys stuff for cash. Even knocked-off gear.
<se_def>*: Goes by the name o' Dodgy Dave. Ya can flog stuff to 'im an' get enough for a few drinks. That's wot I do.
<se_high>*: This one loves to talk when he's had a few too many.

<se_high>*: It's all just drunken silly-talk though.
Don't pay too much attention to him.

<se_low>*: Back in me younger years I was a priest, you know. Used to work in a whopper of a church,
I did!
<se_low>*: Then one day, they found out I'd took some o' the church funds for meself and I was shown the door. I'd only done it the once an' all!
<se_low>*: I didn't 'ave no place to go, so after wanderin' 'ere an' there for a bit, I ended up in this town. Course, that was all a long time ago now.
<se_low>*: Just take a look at these iron bars! To stop guests doing a runner without paying, they are! Can you believe it!?
<se_low>*: It's like being in a prison cell!
<se_low>*: Me boy takes care o' sales. If ya wanna buy somefin', go 'round the front an' speak to 'im.

<se_low>*: I just make wot I make.
That's wot a craftsman does, mate.
<se_high>*: Welcome to the mystical fortune-tellin' parlour of Pickham! I knew you would come today. It was written in the stars.
<se_high>*: You... Yes! You want me to use my mystical powers to help you locate somefin', don't you?

<se_high>*: Ya wot!? But...I can't do nuffin' else yet!
I only know 'ow to find stuff!
<se_high>*: I'll run it by ya one more time, eh? You... Yes! You want me to use my mystical powers to help you locate somefin', DON'T YOU?
<se_high>*: That's it! I knew it! Right then... Ahem! Let us commence the mystical fortune-tellin' procedure.
<se_high>*: Oh and by the way, I've got a special offer on. I'm just startin' in this game, see, so it's all free at the minute!
<se_high>*: Anyway, let's get on wiv it, shall we?

<se_high>*: Hocus-pocus, diddle-de-doo!?
Blakaza-fiddle-de-foo! Alaka-wam!?
Alaka-bam! Alaka-piggle-de-poo!
<se_high>*: ...Yes, I see it! The thing you're lookin' for's not in this town.
<se_high>*: It's in a land far, far away. But if you don't give up, you're sure to find it in the end.
<se_high>*: Good luck. I'll do what little I can to help you from here.

<se_high>*: Eh!?
I ain't told you nuffin' ya don't already know?
<se_high>*: Well I'm sorry! I'm only a beginner, ya know! Wot d'ya expect for free, eh!?
<se_low>*: Well, this is a surprise! Most folk in these parts have a rather...limited grasp of religion. They're not great church-goers.
<se_low>*: It's a deplorable situation! ...Oh, dear me! Sorry! I shouldn't be grumbling to you, now should I!?
<se_def>*: This room's just been divided up wiv a few planks right, an' look 'ow many people they've managed to squeeze in!
<se_def>*: I know it looks a bit tight, but it's better than bein' out on the street. At least we've got some shelter from the rain, eh?

<se_low>*: Oh, yeah! This bed's just wot I need.
Got it cheap off Dodgy Dave, ya know.
<se_low>*: Yeah, if there's anyfin' ya need, just go behind the bar in the<endash><page>*: Oops! I better keep me gob shut about that. Dodgy Dave's place is s'posed to be a secret.
<se_def>*: I only went out for a minute, an' me bleedin' bed's gone!

<se_def>*: I know Pickham's got a reputation an' all,
but come on! Pinchin' a bed!? Aaaah, I s'pose I shoulda known betta than to take the chain off.
<se_def>*: You wanna know where the door behind the bar goes?
<se_def>*: Ha ha ha! That ain't somefin' I can go tellin' to any old punter who asks, ya know!
<se_low>*: Apparently there's this jester bloke who's been travellin' around all the towns recently. Bit of a giant, or so I 'ear.
<se_low>*: Wot a nice thing to do, eh? Puttin' yerself out by goin' all over the place just so ya can make people laugh.
<se_low>*: Yeah, there's still a few decent folk left in the world.
<se_def>*: I came here to become a poet and get away from my borin' life in the country. But just look at me! What am I doin'!?
<se_def>*: Damn the clear, blue sky! I hate it!
<se_high>*: My husband doesn't do too badly money-wise, you know. He just spends it all at the pub, that's the trouble.
<se_high>*: If it wasn't for that, we wouldn't find it so hard to make ends meet. Oh, that man really gets my goat!
<se_def>*: Welcome, welcome, welcome! To the shrine of recreation... The social stampin'-ground o' the gentry... PICKHAM CASINO!
<se_def>*: We've slot machines and bingo for your entertainment and pleasure!

<se_def>*: Enjoy! Empty yer pockets!
Dig deep into yer wallet! Have a ball!

<se_def>*: This is the bingo counter.
Would you like me to explain the rules?
<se_def>*: Right then. Here's 'ow it works.
<se_def>*: First off, you've gotta decide 'ow many tokens you wanna put down. Then the game starts.
<se_def>*: You've gotta keep an eye on the cards in yer 'and, while ya watch the numbers on the balls the dealer draws.
<se_def>*: Every time 'e draws a ball, the space on yer card wiv the same number'll get filled in.
<se_def>*: If ya get a line, either horizontal, vertical or diagonal, by the time the dealer's drawn ten balls, it's line-bingo...
<se_def>*: ...And if five of the balls that are drawn are the same colour, it's colour-bingo. Simple as that!
<se_def>*: So there you 'ave it! Enjoy the game!

<se_def>*: Oh! Bit of a dab 'and, are ya?
Sorry, didn't mean no disrespect.
<se_def>*: The quicker you are to get line-bingos, the better the payback on the tokens ya put down. It's nail-bitin' stuff, I tell ya!
<se_low>*: Argh! I ain't 'ad a win in ages!

<se_low>*: I keep thinkin' I've got it in the bag as well.
I get one away, but then the game ends!

<se_high>*: This casino's dull.
And there's hardly anyone here, either.

<se_high>*: No, if you want to see a REAL casino,
you've got to go to Baccarat.
It's big money on the roulette, you know!
<se_low>*: Aaaah...phew... No pay...no way... Aaaah...phew...

<se_high>*: Ahhh! Take it! Take wotever ya want!
But there's nuffin' of value 'ere, I swear!

<se_high>*: ...Huh? Yer not <IF_SOLO>a burglar<ELSE_NOT_SOLO>burglars<ENDIF_SOLO>? Oh, I'm sorry.
It's just there's been so many break-ins recently,
I was sure...
<se_high>*: Anyway, wot d'you expect if you go wanderin' around people's 'ouses in the middle o' the night!?

<se_high>*: It's dangerous for a girl livin' on 'er own,
isn't it? Perhaps I better buy somefin' to defend meself wiv. Just in case.

<se_low>*: You wouldn't know it to look at me now,
but I was the Royal Chancellor once.

<se_low>*: Humph! I can see you don't believe me!
I'm no liar, you know!
<se_low>*: ...I suppose I can hardly be surprised you have your doubts. I must just look like a retired old gent to you.
<se_high>*: Oh, pur-lease! Stay away! Don't come in 'ere and talk to me when I'm goin' to sleep! I 'aven't got me make-up on!
<se_def>*: I said it'll be fine! As long as we're here in Pickham, Golding's men will never find us.
<se_high>*: But those men from the casino could turn up at any time. How can we ever relax?

<se_high>*: I can't live like this any more! You'll just
have to find a way to pay the money back.
I don't care what you have to do!

<se_high>*: The piano doesn't look too bad,
but the tuning's terrible and most of the
keys don't work.
<se_high>*: I don't know where the boss gets this junk!
<se_low>*: Why...am I locked up...? I'm innocent... Ah-phew...

<se_def>*: The bloke who used to own the armour shop 'ere was a bit of a whizz at the old alchemy.
He knew a fair few recipes.

<se_def>*: I think 'e's livin' in Farebury now.
Yeah, that's right.

<se_def>*: He was an oddball, mind! He wouldn't
just 'and you over a recipe if you asked 'im.
He'd make ya work for it!
<se_def>*: I don't s'pose a son should go 'round boastin' about 'is old man, but my dad makes some o' the best weapons goin', an' that's the truth.
<se_def>*: He'd 'ave all kinds o' people placin' orders wiv 'im if only we didn't live where we do.

<se_def>*: But it's no use tryin' to persuade 'im to leave Pickham. I've given it a go 'undreds o' times!<page>*: He can be right pig-'eaded when 'e wants
to be.
<se_low>*: Arrrr-phew... Arrrr-phew...
<se_low>*: I dunno if it's the cramped conditions or what, but don't you feel like you can relax in here?
<se_low>*: I'm so lucky to be able to live in such a cosy space like this!
<se_def>*: Urgh, 'ow am I s'posed to sleep on the floor!? It's too 'ard! I want me bed back!
<se_low>*: It's awright gettin' some shut-eye outside durin' the day, but it's too cold at night.
<se_low>*: Ev'ryone who lives on beggars' alley 'as to spend the night in the pub to keep warm.

<se_def>*: So we never make a fuss about nuffin'.
Gotta stay on the barman's good side, see.
<se_def>*: I mean, 'e lets us 'ang about in 'is pub all night over one drink. Ya can't complain.

<se_low>*: This place gets full of a night, don't it?
I just wanna 'ave a quiet drink somewhere.

<se_low>*: But there's nowhere else to go.
S'pose I'll just 'ave to put up wiv it.
Oh, well.
<se_def>*: I came here to become a poet and get away from my borin' life in the country. But just look at me! What am I doin'!?
<se_def>*: Damn the fluffy, white clouds! I hate them!

<se_def>*: Urgh<endash> 'Ic! More booze!
I want more <endash> 'Ic! <endash> booze!
<se_high>*: There's me thinking, ‘Ah, good! He's finally home,’ but all he wants to do is carry on drinking!

<se_high>*: I've had just about as much as I can take!
He won't be getting any liquor from me!
It'll be vinegar!
<se_high>*: Oooh. I'm no good in the evenin's. Tomorrow. Come back tomorrow an' I'll tell yer fortune.
<se_low>*: There was a geezer who used to live 'ere by the name o' Yangus. He was a funny one.<page>*: Used to try an' make out 'e was cleverer than wot he was by usin' long words.

<se_low>*: But he was always gettin' 'em wrong!
He'd say stuff like ‘spific’ instead of ‘specific’,
and ‘gratistude’ instead of ‘gratitude’!<page>*: Made 'im sound like a prize ignoranus!

<se_low>*: I wonder wot 'e's up to these days.
Be a shame if 'e was lyin' face down in some ditch somewhere! Kah ha hah!

<se_low>*: Y-Yangus!? When did you get back!?
Yer, er...lookin' good as ever, eh!?

<se_low>*: I was dead worried when I didn't 'ear nuffin' from ya after ya left town. But now yer back!
Ha ha! An' yer awright an' ev'ryfin'!
<se_high>*: There's a customer over there at the bar who looks really ill.<page>*: His face is all green. And he's got pointy ears. He looks a bit like a monster!

<se_high>*: Still, it's nothing to do with me.
That's the one rule you have to obey in Pickham.
Don't poke your nose into other people's affairs.
<se_low>King Trode: It never used to be this difficult to get a drink...
<se_low>King Trode: Another thing that wretched Dhoulmagus is responsible for! Confound him and confound this curse!

<se_low>King Trode: But it's Medea who's really suffering.
Turned into a horse just when she was betrothed to be married...

<se_low>King Trode: I told you I would be perfectly fine right here! Kindly refrain from pestering me when I'm enjoying a drink!

Some people 'ave pasts you wouldn't believe!
<se_def>*: A good barman knows not to ask too many questions.

<se_def>*: W-Wot was that noise!?
Cor, it takes a lot to surprise me, I can tell ya!

<se_high>*: That funny-looking customer at the bar has been crying into his glass. He must've been through a lot, I suppose.

<se_high>*: Was...? Was that a horse just now?
What's happened!?

<se_low>*: Back in me younger years, I was a priest, you know. Used to work in a whopper of a church,
I did!
<se_low>*: Then one day, they found out I'd took some o' the church funds for meself and I was shown the door. I'd only done it the once an' all!
<se_low>*: I didn't 'ave no place to go, so after wanderin' 'ere an' there for a bit, I ended up in this town. Course, that was all a long time ago now.

<se_low>*: Hm? Wot's all the fuss about outside?
You can't get a quiet drink anywhere these days!
<se_def>*: Yer horse has been stolen? Yeah, people like you from out o' town make easy marks.
<se_def>*: And this IS Pickham, 'ome of impropriety, crime and vulgarity. ‘You bring 'em wiv ya, we Pick'am off ya!’ That's the story 'round 'ere, mate.
<se_def>*: Has anyone come past 'ere? I dunno, I'm afraid. I was busy watchin' things outside the town walls.

<se_def>*: No one's LEFT town, though.
I can tell you that much for sure.

<se_def>*: Have I seen a stolen 'orse?
Nah, nuffin' like that.
<se_def>*: Nice idea, though. Bet you'd get a good price for an 'orse. I might give it a go some time.
<se_def>*: I saw an 'orse an' cart speedin' off towards the east side o' town.
<se_def>*: Prob'ly went down beggars' alley at a guess.

<se_low>*: I saw Mitts walkin' off towards the watchtower a minute ago. Drunk as a newt,
'e was!<page>*: I was up them steps, an' I could see 'im wobblin' all over the shop!
<se_low>*: He looked pretty pleased wiv 'imself, mind. Must've run into a bit o' luck, I guess.
<se_def>*: Have I seen an 'orse an' cart comin' past?
<se_def>*: Yeah, I saw it. But you ain't gonna get no info from no one on beggars' alley wivout payin' for it, ya know!
<se_def>*: Give us twenty coins, an' I'll tell ya wot I know. Okay?

<se_def>*: Heh heh! Ta very much!
Yeah, the 'orse an' cart came past 'ere.<page>*: It was a bloke called Mitts drivin' it.
He's a thief. An' a lousy one at that!
<se_def>*: He's an 'eavy drinker an' all. Always plastered. I wouldn't put it past 'im to nick an 'orse an' cart to pay for 'is next drink.

<se_def>*: You ain't even got 20!? Right then.
I'll take wotever you 'ave got. Ya lucky beggar!
<se_def>*: Right, the 'orse an' cart came down the alley 'ere. It was a bloke called Mitts who was drivin' it. He's a thief. An' a lousy one at that!
<se_def>*: He's an 'eavy drinker an' all. Always plastered. I wouldn't put it past 'im to nick an 'orse an' cart to pay for 'is next drink.
<se_def>*: Yer flat broke!? Cor, you must be really strugglin', eh!? Awright then, you can 'ave this one on the 'ouse.

<se_def>*: The 'orse an' cart came down the alley 'ere.
It was a bloke called Mitts who was drivin' it.
He's a thief. An' a lousy one at that!
<se_def>*: He's an 'eavy drinker an' all. Always plastered. I wouldn't put it past 'im to nick an 'orse an' cart to pay for 'is next drink.
<se_def>*: Wot, don't wanna pay for somefin' ya can't 'old in yer 'and? That's a bit of an antiquated way of thinkin', innit?
<se_def>*: Anyway, that's your problem. It ain't no skin off my nose. Suit yerself.

<se_def>*: Anyway, I reckon I've given ya yer twenty coins' worth. Nice doin' business wiv ya.
<se_low>*: What!? You've had yer horse and cart stolen!? I'm sorry to hear that.
<se_low>*: Still, I suppose you can always buy another one, eh? Don't let it get you down too much.
<se_def>*: Oh 'ello? Had a spot of bother, 'ave ya?
<se_def>*: How about a drink, eh? To drown yer sorrows. It's the soap o' the soul, ya know. Washes down all yer troubles wivout a trace!
<se_def>*: Oh, no! Hang on a minute! I'm jumpin' the gun 'ere. You're a bit young for drownin' sorrows, aren't ya?
<se_high>*: Oh. That noise we heard before was someone stealing your horse and cart, was it?
<se_high>*: You know, there was a man in here who left just before you came in.
<se_high>*: He's a real drinker, he is. Mitts is his name. He's one of our regulars. Still...I'm sure he wasn't involved!

<se_low>*: Hm? Wot's all the fuss about outside?
You can't get a quiet drink anywhere these days!
